body_html:
@rmlarsen
Depressing..
CI still failing......

I now begin to understand what happens. Could you tell if I am right?

Here is one failed test from the early beginning:

================================================================================
==================== Test output for //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:clip_ops_test:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.platform import test
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/platform/test.py", line 43, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import test_util as _test_util
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/test_util.py", line 57, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import importer
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/importer.py", line 32, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import function
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/function.py", line 38, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import variable_scope as vs
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py", line 40, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import init_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops.py", line 42, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import linalg_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/linalg_ops.py", line 27, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import functional_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py", line 38, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import variable_scope as vs
ImportError: cannot import name variable_scope

function.py -> variable_scope.py -> init_ops.py -> linalg_ops.py ->functional_ops.py -> variable_scope.py
So you suggest to add functional_ops.py as a deps to linalg_ops.
After that, variable_scope.py becomes a cycle.

OK, seems I get the reason.
And one question, is there any docker to run this internal CI build thing locally? I don't want to waiting for kokoro anymore......

body:
@rmlarsen 
Depressing..
CI still failing......

I now begin to understand what happens. Could you tell if I am right?

Here is one failed test from the early beginning:
```
================================================================================
==================== Test output for //tensorflow/python/kernel_tests:clip_ops_test:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.platform import test
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/platform/test.py", line 43, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import test_util as _test_util
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/test_util.py", line 57, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import importer
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/importer.py", line 32, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.framework import function
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/framework/function.py", line 38, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import variable_scope as vs
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py", line 40, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import init_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops.py", line 42, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import linalg_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/linalg_ops.py", line 27, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import functional_ops
  File "/b/s/w/ir/run/bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/clip_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py", line 38, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python.ops import variable_scope as vs
ImportError: cannot import name variable_scope
```

function.py -> variable_scope.py -> init_ops.py -> linalg_ops.py ->functional_ops.py -> variable_scope.py
So you suggest to add functional_ops.py as a deps to linalg_ops.
After that, variable_scope.py becomes a cycle.

OK, seems I get the reason.
~~And one question, is there any docker to run this internal CI build thing locally? I don't want to waiting for kokoro anymore......~~
